body:
I wake up like every morning, i eat that shit cereal because i cant be bothered to buy a better one niether try another one cos im used to it xd, like every morning, i open my ipad which is around 700 years old LOL and read avicus forums, in order to get updates, with map side, and other shit that i should do in my day, as my daily assignments. 
I see that I am banned. I have done a huge mistake.

LONG STORY I WARNED YOU

Let me tell you my story:
I have joined around 3 years ago, on the account orimincrafter that my friend gave me. At that time, I didn't know anything about minecraft, and I remember trying to turn an ore to an ingot and I couldn't figure it out.
Later on, I played on or6663, some other account my friend gave me, and I got addicted to this server immediately. Once my friend showed me the server, I couldn't stop playing. We were used to play mega walls together, so It was in the start 1 game of mega walls and 2 games on avicus, became to just Avicus. I kept playing this server a lot.
I got better with the time, and somebody introduced me to the forums. I started being extremely active, around 4 hours a day playing this game. 

It's been 1.5 years, and I am really active on the forums. People are excited about TS, so I joined it too. My english level is literally shit, and I was muted listening to others. From time to time i'd talk, but just to my closest friends. Later on, my best friend died in a car accident and I was really sad, and he was literally the friend I spoke to shit ton of time a day. I was bored, and sad. I enjoy rushing in public and become one of the most overrated players in the game, for some reason. I get falsely banned for autoclicking, which I have never done on Avicus. 

It's been 2 years, I am very active on teamspeak and the forums. I start getting into building. I build my first map for avicus which obviously gets denied. I am frustrated because the amount of effort I put into it. I don't give up, keep building, submit around 30 maps at total, all of them has my best efforts put into. Later on, my maps start to get accepted and I am happy and motivated, keeping to build more and more. I suddenly get really pretty good at building. I start getting more into competitive. I get into fortissimus and play the omega championship with them. They were fun people, but not serious, however they introduced me into the competitve aspect of the game.

It's been 2.5 years. I join Apollo, my family on here, I love them so much, and I get along with each one of them. We play many matches together and I carry some q:^) and everybody loves playing on this team. We play tournament 2  together and I double cap in the 3rd place match :D. Later on I break the monument in the league against CBT in the last 2 seconds. Probably one of my most memorable moments ever. My builds become appreciated and I become a mapdev. Probably this is my best time here. I get Jr Mod later on but get demoted because I didnt succeed my trial. I focus on being a mapdev for the mean time and build shit ton of maps and help players with ymls, buildings, and all. At this part, I have reached everything I can and I dreamed about in this server, so I become active 8 hours a day or more and 12 on saturdays. That's a huge amount of time. All this time, on this server. 

It's been 3 years. I am in Apollo, preparing to play tournament 3. I have personal relationship with each one of you reading that post probably, and I have probably spoken to you in the past and probably been friends. I become even closer with Apollo, and I love all of them the most. <3. I enjoy my job as mapdev. I get builder on Badlion, and then it's a bit harder for me to keep up with the work I used to do. I become a bit less active but still spend at least 4 hours a day on this server. I open a youtube channel and really get into editing. I get a lot of positive feedback on my videos and I am motivated to make more.

One day comes, and I watch nikeboom's video and was pretty excited over it. He has the notepad open on the background, so you could see what he does in order to steal accounts. For some reason I wanted to try it, so I tried it on HaloGuardian101. I have no idea why him. He was just on TS at that time. It worked and I did it just for testing purposes, wasn't actually going to do something with it. But I did get access to his account. Probably one of my worst mistakes here. I talked with halo on skype and explained him the situation. I promised I won't do anything with his account, I don't need it either. I regret doing that. I got demoted from mapdev for immaturity as well apparently and that thing. I wish I wouldn't have done that.

I will probably appeal in 2 months or so according to posighdun. I will keep being active in ts, and will be actively making maps. 
This post is not a leaving post since I will keep being on ts until the end of this server and as well will be actively on the forums and building. Keep in touch with me: my skype: eric_mcgamer.

I love you all, thanks for all the amazing moments <333333

title: I love you

replies.body:
I can't imagine how it must feel: having years of dedication and time put in to achieving what you dreamt, and now it's gone. All gone.

Apollo is going to miss such a commendable, improved and dedicated team member. I hope you stick around, because we'll always welcome you back.

See you around, pal. <3

See you around, pal. <3

We'll get right to it: Today we ask you to help Wikipedia. We're sustained by donations averaging about €10. If we all gave €2, the fundraiser would be over in an hour.
SELECT A PAYMENT METHOD

Greece (Greek: Ελλάδα, Elláda [eˈlaða]), officially the Hellenic Republic (Greek:Ελληνική Δημοκρατία, Ellīnikī́ Dīmokratía [eliniˈci ðimokraˈti.a]; Greek: Ελλάς, Ellás, from the ancient Greek name Hellas Ἑλλάς, and known since ancient times as Hellas(/ˈhɛləs/;[8][9][10][11][12][13][14][15] is a country located in southeastern Europe. According to the 2011 census, Greece's population is around 10.8 million. Athens is the nation's capital and largest city, followed byThessaloniki, which is commonly referred to as the co-capital.

Greece is strategically located at the crossroads of Europe, Asia, and Africa. Situated on the southern tip of the Balkan peninsula, it shares land borders with Albaniato the northwest, the Republic of Macedoniaand Bulgaria to the north and Turkey to the northeast. Greece consists of ninegeographic regions: Macedonia, Central Greece, the Peloponnese, Thessaly, Epirus, the Aegean Islands (including theDodecanese and Cyclades), Thrace, Crete, and the Ionian Islands. The Aegean Sea lies to the east of the mainland, the Ionian Sea to the west, and the Mediterranean Sea to the south. Greece has the longest coastline on the Mediterranean Basin and the 11th longest coastline in the world at 13,676 km (8,498 mi) in length, featuring a vast number of islands, of which 227 are inhabited. Eighty percent of Greece is mountainous, with Mount Olympusbeing the highest peak at 2,918 metres (9,573 ft).

Greece has one of the longest histories of any country, and is considered the cradle ofWestern civilization, having been the birthplace of democracy, Western philosophy, the Olympic Games, Western literature,[16]historiography, political science, majorscientific and mathematical principles, andWestern drama, including both tragedy andcomedy. The Greeks were first unified underPhilip of Macedon in the fourth century BC. His son Alexander the Great rapidly conquered much of the ancient world, spreading Greek culture and science from the eastern Mediterranean to the Indus River.Annexed by Rome in the second century BC, Greece became an integral part of the Roman Empire and its successor, the Byzantine Empire. The first century AD saw the establishment of the Greek Orthodox Church, which shaped the modern Greek identity and transmitted Greek traditions to the widerOrthodox World.[17] Falling under Ottoman dominion in the mid-15th century, the modernnation state of Greece emerged in 1830 following a war of independence. Greece's rich historical legacy is reflected in large part by its 17 UNESCO World Heritage Sites, among the most in Europe and the world.[18]

Greece is a democratic and developed country with an advanced high-income economy, a high quality of life and a very highstandard of living. A founding member of theUnited Nations, Greece was the tenth member to join the European Communities (precursor to the European Union) and has been part of the Eurozone since 2001. It is also a member of numerous other international institutions, including the Council of Europe, NATO,[a]OECD, OIF, OSCE and the WTO. Greece's unique cultural heritage, subsequently largetourism industry, and prominent shipping sector classify it as a middle power. It is thelargest economy in the Balkans, where it is an important regional investor.

A founding member of theUnited Nations, Greece was the tenth member to join the European Communities (precursor to the European Union) and has been part of the Eurozone since 2001. It is also a member of numerous other international institutions, including the Council of Europe, NATO,[a]OECD, OIF, OSCE and the WTO. Greece's unique cultural heritage, subsequently largetourism industry, and prominent shipping sector classify it as a middle power. It is thelargest economy in the Balkans, where it is an important regional investor.

Greece (Greek: Ελλάδα, Elláda [eˈlaða]), officially the Hellenic Republic (Greek:Ελληνική Δημοκρατία, Ellīnikī́ Dīmokratía [eliniˈci ðimokraˈti.a]; Greek: Ελλάς, Ellás, from the ancient Greek name Hellas Ἑλλάς, and known since ancient times as Hellas(/ˈhɛləs/;[8][9][10][11][12][13][14][15] is a country located in southeastern Europe. According to the 2011 census, Greece's population is around 10.8 million. Athens is the nation's capital and largest city, followed byThessaloniki, which is commonly referred to as the co-capital.

Greece is strategically located at the crossroads of Europe, Asia, and Africa. Situated on the southern tip of the Balkan peninsula, it shares land borders with Albaniato the northwest, the Republic of Macedoniaand Bulgaria to the north and Turkey to the northeast. Greece consists of ninegeographic regions: Macedonia, Central Greece, the Peloponnese, Thessaly, Epirus, the Aegean Islands (including theDodecanese and Cyclades), Thrace, Crete, and the Ionian Islands. The Aegean Sea lies to the east of the mainland, the Ionian Sea to the west, and the Mediterranean Sea to the south. Greece has the longest coastline on the Mediterranean Basin and the 11th longest coastline in the world at 13,676 km (8,498 mi) in length, featuring a vast number of islands, of which 227 are inhabited. Eighty percent of Greece is mountainous, with Mount Olympusbeing the highest peak at 2,918 metres (9,573 ft).

Greece has one of the longest histories of any country, and is considered the cradle ofWestern civilization, having been the birthplace of democracy, Western philosophy, the Olympic Games, Western literature,[16]historiography, political science, majorscientific and mathematical principles, andWestern drama, including both tragedy andcomedy. The Greeks were first unified underPhilip of Macedon in the fourth century BC. His son Alexander the Great rapidly conquered much of the ancient world, spreading Greek culture and science from the eastern Mediterranean to the Indus River.Annexed by Rome in the second century BC, Greece became an integral part of the Roman Empire and its successor, the Byzantine Empire. The first century AD saw the establishment of the Greek Orthodox Church, which shaped the modern Greek identity and transmitted Greek traditions to the widerOrthodox World.[17] Falling under Ottoman dominion in the mid-15th century, the modernnation state of Greece emerged in 1830 following a war of independence. Greece's rich historical legacy is reflected in large part by its 17 UNESCO World Heritage Sites, among the most in Europe and the world.[18]

Greece is a democratic and developed country with an advanced high-income economy, a high quality of life and a very highstandard of living. A founding member of theUnited Nations, Greece was the tenth member to join the European Communities (precursor to the European Union) and has been part of the Eurozone since 2001. It is also a member of numerous other international institutions, including the Council of Europe, NATO,[a]OECD, OIF, OSCE and the WTO. Greece's unique cultural heritage, subsequently largetourism industry, and prominent shipping sector classify it as a middle power. It is thelargest economy in the Balkans, where it is an important regional investor.

replies.body:
Dang Eric,

You've always been a great friend, I remember back to the days when we would talk about airplanes, and the great times we had on Fort, messing around and having way too much fun. When you left Fort I was extremely sad, but it was understandable since we really weren't that serious. You've always been friendly, caring, and accepting to everyone, and remember to always stay that way. We all make mistakes, I hope you learn from this one and come back stronger than ever. Thanks for everything, and remember... ALL HEIL EWIC! <3

replies.body:
Was this post really necessary? Like c'mon.

Anyway, I hope you get appealed Eric. I remember when you would often come to me for advice on mapmaking and whatnot and would come to me for terraforming or opinions on a project you were working on.

After I became inactive for a long while we fell out of touch due to my disappearance - I didn't even realize that you were Xuph until yesterday... strange. Anyway, I hope that we can get back in touch with eachother.

Hit me up on Skype man, I wanna build some maps with ya ;)

I'm also really happy that you're also deciding to stay and still become active. I'll see you ingame in the next two months bro :)
